lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
Bob is a **task manager** for use via a Command Line Interface.
*Note: All items in carrot brackets are to be filled by the user*
Displays a list of commands and their usage.
Adds a todo task with task description
The following todo task has been added
Adds a deadline task with task description and deadline
The following deadline task has been added
Adds an event task with task description and start time
* Start time must be formatted as *yyyy-MM-ddThh:mm:ss*
The following event task has been added
Displays all tasks currently stored with description containing the keyword
The following task have been found:
Marks the task with the specified index as complete.
The following task has been marked as:
Deletes the task of the specified index
The following task has been deleted:
* Initialises Duke and Loads the saved Task file, if any
* Waits for user command input, detects and executes it until exit command is given
* Stops the execution of the program
* Executes the command and returns the result.
* Adds a deadline task to the task list
public static final String SUCCESS_MESSAGE = "The following deadline task has been added\n";
* Deletes the task with the specified index
public static final String SUCCESS_MESSAGE = "The following task has been deleted:\n";
* Marks the task at the specified index as complete
public static final String SUCCESS_MESSAGE = "The following task has been marked as:\n";
public static final String NO_TASK_BY_THAT_INDEX_MESSAGE = "There is no task by that number.\n";
* Adds an event task to the task list
public static final String SUCCESS_MESSAGE = "The following event task has been added\n";
return "The program will now save and exit\n";
* Looks for all tasks containing a search string
public static final String SUCCESS_MESSAGE = "The following tasks have been found:\n";
public static final String SUCCESS_MESSAGE = "The following is the list of commands: \n" +
"done <task index>\nMarks task number <task index> as done. <task index> should be an integer\n" +
"find <text to search>\nSearches for Tasks containing the given text string\n" +
* Displays all tasks currently in the task list
public static final String SUCCESS_MESSAGE = "List of Tasks:\n";
* Adds a todo task to the task list
public static final String SUCCESS_MESSAGE = "The following todo task has been added\n";
* This exception is thrown when the input by the user contains insufficient parameters
* For example, a deadline task without a "/by" or an event without a "/at"
return "There are insufficient parameters in your input. Type \"help\" for command syntax.";
* This exception is thrown when the user enters an invalid command
return "Unknown Command Entered. Type \"help\" for a list of available commands.";
* Processes the user input into the command type and the parameters involved. Returns the command to be executed
* @param userInput the input string of the user
* @throws InsufficientParametersException when required parameters are not detected
* @throws UnknownCommandException         when the input string is not a supported command
public Command parse(String userInput) throws InsufficientParametersException, UnknownCommandException {
This section contains the relevant code for the loading of the stored task file
* Checks for the existence of the {@code data} folder, and creates one if it does not exist
* @return loadedTaskList The Tasks read from the data file
* @throws FileNotFoundException if the {@code data} folder cannot be found
* Reads the contents of the {@code tasks} file
* @throws FileNotFoundException if the {@code tasks} file does not exist
* Processes the data stored in the task file and stores it in loadedTaskList
* Converts the String given into the appropriate format that can be parsed as a localDateTime object
* @param dateTime the datetime string in the saved file
return year + "-" + month + "-" + day + "T" + hour + ":" + minute + ":" + second;
This section contains the relevant codes for the writing of the task list to the stored file
* Saves the current tasks stored in task list to the text file.
* @param taskList the arraylist containing the current tasks
* @throws IOException if error writing to the file
public static void save(TaskList taskList) throws IOException {
public Deadline(String task, boolean isDone, LocalDateTime dueDate) {
public Event(String task, boolean isDone, LocalDateTime timing) {
public Task(String task, boolean isDone, TaskTypes taskType) {
* Handles and Keeps track of the tasks
private static final String NO_TASK_MESSAGE = "No tasks\n";
* Adds a task to the task list
* @param task the task to be added
* @return the string describing the task added
* Sends the list of tasks to be printed. No task message if no tasks are in the system.
* Marks the specified task as done
* @param index the index of the task to be marked as done
* @return the description of the tasked marked as done
* Deletes a task from the task list
* @param index the index of the task to be deleted
* @return the description of the task deleted
* Sends the description of the newest task to be printed
* @return the description of the newest task
* Deals with the communication with the user
+ "For a list of commands, type: help\n"
private static final String HELP_MESSAGE = "Type \"help\" for a list of commands and their syntax.";
public static final String EXIT_MESSAGE = BORDER + "Bye. Have a nice day!\n" + BORDER;

* Prints the error message from the exceptions caught from the user input
